ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi's response to a very well thought out post
ygData.msgSnippet: I originally thought that as well, that it was just that I was having trouble getting into groups and not my bard.  Then I did an experiment with my original
ygData.messageBody:
I originally thought that as well, that it was just that "I" was having
trouble getting into groups and not my bard. Then I did an experiment with
my original bard on Sol Ro. I walked around several zones asking some
groups if I could join. 7 out of eleven said they weren't interested for
various reasons, I was too high a level, I was too low a level, they didn't
really need another member, etc. I then ran around the same groups with my
enchanter and every single one had room for me. My enchanter was the exact
same level at the time as my bard. Two of the groups reasoning seemed
somewhat logical, but for 4 of them it was patently obvious they had no
interest in a bard. I had my friend try with his warrior who was one level
higher and he only got refused by 2 groups. There are definitely some
people who will only group with a character they think will make them able
to get more xp/loot/etc.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Jeffrey Sue [mailto:jsue@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 14, 2000 11:13 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi's response to a very well thought out post



At 02:26 PM 9/14/00 +0200, you wrote:
>
>
>I can just see this (try to think about it) ;)
>
>If bards are the best grouping class in all Everquest,
>every group should love to have one.
>But in the reality of Norath, a bard can hardly find a group.

say what?


>So something is wrong, and i know that's not the "a bard can hardly find a
>group"

maybe that's ''you can hardly find a group'', but i definitely have no
problems finding
a group with my bard. maybe you need to make some friends.


>Nothing to say more.
